conclusion: Consider changes in position and size of objects A, B, C, and D when the light source moves backward.
Object B is a pair of sandals.
Position of the objects remains the same initially.
Size of the objects remains the same initially.
Objects will move backward relative to the light source when it moves backward.
Position of the objects will change in the direction of the light source's movement.
Size of the objects will remain the same relative to each other and to the light source.
Final position of Object A: The cake will move backward.
Final position of Object B: The sandals will move backward.
Final position of Object C: The slabs will move backward.
Final position of Object D: The slabs will move backward.
Final size of the objects: The size will remain the same relative to each other and to the light source.
